reviews.text: Handy if you need a train . 😉🤣😂🤣
Impossible to contact, no number exists for the station apparently and numbers I can contact were zero to no help.

The station's fairly decent for this part of Essex but what rude and unhelpful staff. Tried buying an advance ticket and was refused sale as they were convinced I was going to try to travel on it before validity despite repeated assurances from me that I would wait. Another reason I never normally travel by train.

On one side of platform no disabled access at all if you require to go on the other side of the platform. I physically struggled to get on the stairs across the bridge. Not just this station but few others to. Need to keep up with the 21st century and also have disabled access ie lifts/slopes. Especially when boarding the trains need station workers with ramps at all times when trains are running.
